title: Reinforcement Learning-Based Nonlinear MIMO System Control Design

context.prior_knowledge: Foundations of Control Theory, Understanding of Linear Systems, Python/PyTorch-Based Programming Experience, and Basic Neural Network Structures
context.additional_context: Designed as an evening course for working professionals, emphasizing practical application case studies.

learning_goals: The mathematical modeling process of nonlinear MIMO systems can be explained in three or more stages
Control signal generation processes can be simulated by implementing an Actor-Critic reinforcement learning algorithm in Python
A report analyzing system error convergence using Lyapunov stability theory can be written
Coordinated control strategies for two or more subsystems in a MIMO system environment can be designed
Projects to improve online adaptive control algorithms using real industrial data can be conducted
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
